result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J Robinson

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:17 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF312, 22CM480.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Anne Katte appears in 21CF312 and Atty Joseph Kaupie appears in 22CM480.

Date and time set for review hearing; VRCW. 
Atty Kaupie makes statement; working on joint agreement. 

COURT sets PTC for 10/12/22 at 2:45 p.m. and argued sentence for 12/05/22 at 2:15 p.m. (20 mins).  

Adj:  10:21 a.m.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:58 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF312, 22CM480.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Anne Katte.

Date and time set for motion hearing in 21CF312 to revoke DEOJ. 
COURT reviews motion and recites history of agreement.  
Atty Katte states they are not objecting to motion; Atty Katte advises new charges picked up by defendant are represented by Atty Kaupie and requests matter be set for sentencing hearing. 
ADA Brubacher has no objection.  

COURT grants motion and revokes DEOJ on Count 2 (Possession of THC) in 21CF312 and enters judgment. 

COURT sets review/TP on both matters for 9/28/22 at 10:15 a.m. 

Adj:  11:02 a.m.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  CJB and MMT.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  No possession of any air soft guns.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:58 pm 
State appears by ADA Davis Runde; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Paige Metzman. 
Reading Waived. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): CJB and MMT. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- No possession of any air soft guns. 

BRANCH 4 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 6/21/2022 at 3:10 pm.
